meanings.sent1: After the meeting, the reaggregation of data was necessary to analyze the results.
meanings.sent2: The reaggregation of the scattered puzzle pieces helped complete the picture.
meanings.sent3: The reaggregation of socks after laundry always seems to result in missing pairs.
meanings.sent4: The reaggregation of thoughts after a long day can be challenging.
meanings.sent5: The reaggregation of ingredients in the recipe made it taste just right.

meanings.definition: The process of combining separate elements into a single whole again.
meanings.sent1: The reaggregation of funds from different sources was crucial for the project.
meanings.sent2: In biology, reaggregation of cells is essential for tissue regeneration.
meanings.sent3: The reaggregation of toys into one big pile delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The reaggregation of colors in the painting created a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The reaggregation of scattered leaves into a pile made yard work easier.
